Key Arguments: The legislation infringes on freedom of expression, which is considered an inalienable right.
The proposal is seen as a means for the government to control and suppress the voices of ordinary Australians.
The legislation is perceived as deceitful, presented under the guise of protecting citizens.
There is a fear that the legislation will lead to a totalitarian state where thoughts are controlled.
Main Themes: Deception and distrust in government intentions
Historical context of fighting for freedoms
Notable Quotes: It is with regret that this proposal has seen the light of day in a society where our forebears fought and died for our freedoms and this proposal has the determination to take that away.
The deception of this proposed legislation is as usual well executed.
If a totalitarian government such as this takes away our voice, then eventually it will as by design take away our thoughts.
